repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
luv callback `vim.uv.new_timer():start(0, 0, function() error() end)`
causes SIGSEGV, since `xstrdup` on NULL return by `lua_tostring`.
(similar to
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/commit/a5b1b83a2693ffa7a5a0a22b3693d36ea60051be)

Solution:
Check NULL before `xstrdup`.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,4 +159,34 @@ describe('vim.uv', function()
   it("is equal to require('luv')", function()
     eq(true, exec_lua("return vim.uv == require('luv')"))
   end)
+
+  it('handle non-string error #32595', function()

comment_data.body:
Should we use a name that is less likely to have a false positive (from some other test or whatever)?
```suggestion
      vim.uv.fs_stat('non-existent-file', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -159,4 +159,34 @@ describe('vim.uv', function()
   it("is equal to require('luv')", function()
     eq(true, exec_lua("return vim.uv == require('luv')"))
   end)
+
+  it('non-string error() #32595', function()
+    local screen = Screen.new(50, 10)
+    exec_lua(function()
+      local timer = assert(vim.uv.new_timer())
+      timer:start(0, 0, function()
+        timer:close()
+        error()
+      end)
+    end)
+    local s = [[
+                                                        |
+      {1:~                                                 }|*5
+      {3:                                                  }|
+      {9:Error executing callback:}                         |
+      {9:[NULL]}                                            |
+      {6:Press ENTER or type command to continue}^           |
+    ]]
+    screen:expect(s)
+    feed('<cr>')
+    n.assert_alive()
+    exec_lua(function()
+      vim.uv.fs_stat('foo', function()

comment_data.body:
Passing `nil` explicitly maybe helps communicate the intention.
```suggestion
        error(nil)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:

   end)

+    exec_lua(function()
+      local timer = assert(vim.uv.new_timer())
+      timer:start(0, 0, function()
+        timer:close()
+        error()

comment_data.body: Don't matter? `callback` will run `error()` no matter file exist or not.

comment_data.body:
This 2nd expect() triggers a warning. To avoid that, maybe try `<c-l>` or `:redraw!` after line 182.

```
2025-02-23T15:55:10.0672736Z [32m[2mRUN     [0m[0m T3441 vim.uv non-string error() #32595: 
2025-02-23T15:55:10.0673919Z warning: Screen test succeeded immediately. Try to avoid this unless the
2025-02-23T15:55:10.0674980Z purpose of the test really requires it.
2025-02-23T15:55:10.0675931Z There are intermediate states between the two identical expects.
2025-02-23T15:55:10.0677180Z Use screen:snapshot_util() or screen:redraw_debug() to find them, and add them
2025-02-23T15:55:10.0678899Z to the test if they make sense.
2025-02-23T15:55:10.0679332Z 
2025-02-23T15:55:10.0679515Z stack traceback:
2025-02-23T15:55:10.0680081Z 	test/functional/ui/screen.lua:858: in function '_wait'
2025-02-23T15:55:10.0680755Z 	test/functional/ui/screen.lua:518: in function 'expect'
2025-02-23T15:55:10.0681398Z 	test/functional/lua/loop_spec.lua:188: in function <test/functional/lua/loop_spec.lua:163>
```

comment_data.body: seems heavy-handed. if we are doing this we could instead specify `unchanged=true` in the 2nd expect() below.

title: fix(lua): SIGSEGV in luv callback with error(nil)
